# runLoopModesForAnimating

**Instance Property**

An array of strings representing the run loop modes in which the animation can run.

## Declaration

```swift
var runLoopModesForAnimating: [RunLoop.Mode]? { get }
```

## Discussion

The default value of this property is `nil`, which indicates that the animation can be run in the default, modal, or event-tracking modes. The value of this property is ignored if the animation blocking mode is something other than [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/BlockingMode/nonblocking].

For information about run loop modes and for constants, see [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/RunLoop].

## Configuring an Animation

- **animationBlockingMode**: The blocking mode of the animation.
- **animationCurve**: The timing curve for the animation.
- **duration**: The duration of the animation, in seconds.
- **frameRate**: The number of frame updates per second to generate for the animation.
